question_text: Which of the following statements are true regarding PCIe architecture? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Each device gets dedicated lanes to the chipset
PCIe slots are always backward compatible by version
PCIe x8 cards fit in x16 slots
PCIe uses a shared bandwidth model
correct_answer: Each device gets dedicated lanes to the chipset
PCIe x8 cards fit in x16 slots
explanation: PCIe provides point-to-point lanes per device and allows smaller lane cards to fit larger physical slots. However, version compatibility is not guaranteed by all motherboards.
